title: 103_s212
content:
The "Federal Reserve Reform Act of 1993" may be cited as such. It involves consultation between the Federal Open Market Committee and key government officials. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to require consultation between the Federal Open Market Committee and key government officials before submitting reports to Congress and the President's budget. The President must submit the budget as required by section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code. SEC. 3. APPOINTMENT OF THE CHAIRMAN AND VICE CHAIRMAN. The President appoints the Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board with Senate approval. The Chairman's term ends on January 31 after the President's term, and if they don't complete their term, a replacement is appointed. The Vice Chairman serves a 4-year term. The Vice Chairman of the Federal Reserve Board serves a 4-year term and may continue after their term until a successor is in place. In the absence of the Chairman, the Vice Chairman or another Board member designated by the Chairman can perform the Chairman's duties. If the Chairman's position is vacant, the Vice Chairman takes over until a successor is appointed. If both positions are vacant, the Board member with the most years of service will assume the duties. The member of the Board with the most years of service will act as Chairman until a successor is appointed. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, and the current Chairman will complete their term despite the changes. SEC. 4. DISCLOSURE OF INTERMEDIATE TARGETS.

Amends the Federal Reserve Act to require disclosure of any changes in intermediate targets for monetary policy adopted by the Committee to the public. Intermediate targets include policy objectives related to monetary aggregates, credit aggregates, prices, interest rates, or bank reserves.

SEC. 5. AUDIT OF FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS BY COMPTROLLER GENERAL. SEC. 5. AUDIT OF FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS BY COMPTROLLER GENERAL. Amends Section 714(b) of title 31, United States Code to allow audits by the Comptroller General of written communications related to transactions within the Federal Reserve System. SEC. 6. BOARD SUBJECT TO BUDGET PROCESS. The Federal Reserve Board and all Federal Reserve Banks must provide their estimated receipts and proposed expenditures for the current year and the next 2 years to the President by October 16 each year. This information will be transmitted to Congress without any changes along with the budget submission.
